content: this is dmg and bacon needs a trough making a trough all right so when it
grabs and popsicle sticks and on those we are going to measure just off the
curve piece which we're going to say for later for centimeters I don't know what
that's in in inches but it's for centimeters and not off the curve pieces
and cut out the four centimeter long planks then with some hot glue down one
side we're going to glue two planks together one at 45 degree angle to the
other one well approximately 45 degrees I didn't really ever protracted to check
it and then some hot glue down the other side and put the other piece again at 45
degrees and when the glue is slightly cooled because it is hot glue you can
swap it off with your finger now the other ends we're going to be placing
some more more popsicle stick so on an offcut or another one if you need one
we're going to just trace the angle line on both sides and make sure that you
just drop it in a little bit I'm using that marker so it's better to use a
pencil you'll get a better line and make sure you get that shape correct and cut
that out and then we're going to stick those on the ends of the trough so this
is relatively a simple so far and in hot glue on sides plop on the extra edges
and voila we have a trough well not really we need to have the stand
thingamajigs so there's off cut curves that we had
before and about six of the way in from the edge blow hot glue and what the
curved edge towards the underside of the trough and again on the other side about
one-sixth the way in and there you have it you've got stands that's nice and
easy go see pretty simple so what we want to
do is we want to put some stuff in this trough now so what we're going to do is
first paint the yeah the wood so we've got the wood
grain and everything so you can use any one of the wood painting methods I just
used the ink just for save time because I like to do things quickly hence I use
hot glue then are you going to put some hot glue in there and while it's still
hot put a couple of blobs of any color paint you like and then mix it around on
the toothpick and add more hot glue on top and that's gonna make a nice mush
girl that you know you really wouldn't want to eat it out of or drink out of as
the case may be and then finish off your wood with some of the paint wood
painting techniques and there you have it that is a very simple trough so
that's how we made it off with bacon now if you like this video you can also
